title: GenAI Applied
description: Practical applications and real-world use cases of Generative AI
intro: This page focuses on using GenAI in the real world: spotting where it already shows up, deciding what to build, and integrating it into products and developer workflows.

sections.title: What You Can Build Today
sections.intro: The best way to learn AI development is to build something real.
learningPath: Start with a simple chat interface to understand AI interactions
Try GitHub Copilot or similar tools in your development environment
Experiment with prompt changes and measure output quality
Build a small application using Azure OpenAI or GitHub Models
Join AI communities and forums and learn from examples

projects.title: Build an MCP server
projects.description: Connect AI to your own data. Create a Model Context Protocol server that gives Claude or Copilot access to your company's documentation, your personal notes, or a live database.

projects.title: Create a coding agent
projects.description: Handle routine tasks automatically. Use GitHub Copilot's agent mode or build your own with Microsoft Agent Framework.

projects.title: Deploy a RAG chatbot
projects.description: Build a knowledge base for your team. Connect Azure OpenAI to your internal docs and let people ask questions in natural language.

projects.title: Automate document processing
projects.description: Use vision models to extract data from receipts, contracts, or forms. Classify images. Generate alt text.

projects.title: Build a multi-agent system
projects.description: Let specialized agents collaborate. One agent retrieves context, another generates code, a third reviews quality.

sections.title: GitHub Copilot
sections.intro: GitHub Copilot is an AI pair programmer that provides real-time code suggestions, chat capabilities, and agent-based assistance directly in your development environment.
capabilities: Code completion: Suggests functions, code blocks, and entire implementations
Chat interface: Conversational help for reasoning about code and debugging
Multi-language support: Works across dozens of programming languages
Context awareness: Understands your repository structure and patterns

modes.name: Ask mode
modes.description: Best for explanations, exploring options, and quick checks

modes.name: Edit mode
modes.description: Best for refining existing code, documentation, and configuration files

modes.name: Agent mode
modes.description: Best for multi-step tasks where the AI plans and executes changes autonomously

customization: AGENTS.md: Agent-specific instructions for the coding agent
Custom agents: Define specialized agents with specific tools and behaviors

faq.question: When should I refactor using my IDE versus using Copilot?
faq.answer: Use IDE refactoring tools for standard operations like renaming symbols. Use Copilot for refactors that require understanding intent and cross-file reasoning.

faq.question: Which mode should I use for a complex feature implementation?
faq.answer: Start with Ask mode to discuss the approach, then use Agent mode for implementation, and Edit mode for refinements.
